gemm-precision-type: Mixed precision (e.g., FP32 multiplication with FP64 accumulation)
library-description: Density functional theory for materials modelling, using the plane-wave pseudopotential method. Can use ultrasoft pseudopotentials (Vanderbilt scheme) or norm-conserving.
gemm-input-data-type: Mini-apps or extracted kernels from real applications
materials-other-specify: Vibrational spectra (IR, Raman, INS), NMR spectra, Core-loss and low-loss EELS, optical properties
gen-sym-computation-type: Large-scale single problems (e.g., one large generalized eigenproblem at a time, using significant computational resources)
Mix of large and small problems (varying resource requirements)
Repeated similar-sized problems (e.g., time evolution or parameter sweeps)
Many independent smaller problems (e.g., batch processing multiple generalized eigenproblems simultaneously)
gen-sym-matrix-structure: A is dense, B is sparse
A is dense, B is dense
gen-sym-reduction-method: Cholesky factorization of B (B = LLᵗ or B = L*L)
gen-sym-reduction-needed: Yes, sometimes (depends on solver or problem)
gemm-future-features-other: Row/column distributions rather than block-cyclic ; when block-cyclic, proper optimisations for block-size 1
cholesky-matrix-format-other: The update vectors, where matrix is constructed from low-rank updates
gen-sym-herm-input-data-type: Mini-apps or extracted kernels from real applications
gen-sym-scaling-requirements: Both strong and weak scaling needed
cholesky-sparsity-structure-other: Two main classes, one dense, the other low-rank plus diagonal
cholesky-matrix-distribution-other: For "block row/column" block size is usually 1 for load-balancing elsewhere
